title: Strictly's Will Bayley could be forced to quit as Katya and Neil face injuries
text:
Their future on Strictly hangs in the balance (Picture: BBC One – Rex)

Strictly Come Dancing contestant Will Bayley could be forced to quit the show after a fall in rehearsals landed him with a nasty knee injury.

Given a bye for one week after jumping off a table in rehearsals and collapsing in on his knee, the Paralympian has remained quiet about whether he’ll be forced to quit or not.

However, sources have now revealed that doctors have told him he will be unable to compete with dance partner Janette Manrara on Saturday – and he could be ruled out for the rest of the competition.

Posting only a few cryptic messages in the hope that he’ll be able to return, it looks like the star has got his wish and has not yet currently been forced to leave the competition.

The star more recently posted a picture of himself and his dance partner on Instagram with the caption: ‘Keep on smiling’ – so it looks like he’s not letting his knee injury get him down.

We hope he doesn’t quit the show (Picture: BBC)

A show source told The Sun: ‘Will is devastated as he’s put everything into the series and a freak injury looks like it may well be the end of the road for him.

‘He’s got a final consultation today and that could be it.

‘He’s already had a number of appointments with doctors and physios to see if there is any way he can get through, but with each day of training, he misses the less likely it is.’

Katya has also been out of action (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC/BBC/PA Wire)

Things are also not looking good for a few of the other contestants as they have also been out of action due to injuries.

It is a worrying start for professional dancer Katya Jones as she couldn’t rehearse yesterday due to a neck injury, meaning her partner Mike Bushell couldn’t practice their routine.

Katya’s ex-husband Neil Jones couldn’t train after he had to pull out of the show at the last minute on Saturday, with fellow dancer Kevin Clifton having to take his place.

Strictly have announced this week’s dance routines and Will is still in the line-up at the moment.

If he takes part he will be going up against Alex Scott and (hopefully) returning partner Neil, who will be performing and American Smooth to Marvin Gaye’s Ain’t No Mountain High Enough.

Mike and Katya have been in the dance-off for the past two weeks in a row, and will now have a bigger fight than ever to keep their place after loved stars Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe leaving last Sunday sparked a massive backlash.

With just nine couples remaining on the show, the stakes are getting higher in order to fight for their place.

On Sunday, the Strictly pros will be paying tribute to Elton John with their group performance, and Emeli Sande will perform her new single Shine.

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday at 7.15pm on BBC One.
